With regards to other non-biologic agents such as leflunomide (LEF), sulfasalazine (SSZ), hydroxychloroquine (HCQ), and azathioprine (AZA), cases of HBVr are extremely rare, and these drugs should be generally considered safe.
17 In a recent prospective study of chronically HBV-infected RA patients treated with MTX, LEF, SSZ, or HCQ without antiviral prophylaxis, only 4/211 (1.8%) developed HBVr; all 4 patients were also receiving GCs, and, thus, the exact contribution of these agents to HBVr is unclear.
36 Similarly, among patients with rheumatic disease and resolved HBV infection taking part in a large prospective multicenter study, use of MTX was not associated with increased risk for HBVr (RR = 0.4).
